column1: Cryoglobulinemia is the presence of abnormal proteins in the blood.
When this occurs, these antibodies can cause inflammation and block blood vessels.
Cryoglobulinemia is part of a group of diseases that cause damage and inflammation of the blood vessels throughout the body (vasculitis).
Type I cryoglobulinemia is most often related to cancer of the blood or immune systems.
Most people with this form of the disease have a chronic hepatitis C infection.
